Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Rockside17
Reviews.Content: A good chain hotel offering cheap rooms just 2 minutes from the tube. The free wifi is a great bonus and worked well. Rooms are spotlessly clean and standard (not big) but what do you expect for this price? There is no wardrobe but a rail with coat hangers. And surprisingly, no cupboards or drawers so you everything stays in your suitcase. I booked the breakfast ahead of my stay and again it was good value with plenty of hams, cheese, rolls, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, sausage plus some good coffee. The room also had a satelite TV with some English language channels but I didn't use them. Front desk seems to operate 24 hours a day. Staff always pleasant and helpful and spoke perfect English. Happy to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “very central Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: okcu2000
Reviews.Content: It is vey near to the Potsdamer platz, sony center. 50-100 meters to the Anhalter bahnhoff s bahn and bus station. Restoration nowadays and construction sounds after 10 am.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close and good value”
Reviews.Author: Marlablue75
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very good for its value. It is a budget hotel, it is simple, but very clean and everything that you need for the price. I found the continental breakfast to be good and simple. The staff were friendly. The rooms were comfortable and simple. I was very happy to stay here. The location is great, just a 20 minute walk from Brandenburg Gate, and easy to walk to many things. It was the perfect place to stay for a solo traveler! I would recommend this place to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “adequate room, decent location”
Reviews.Author: audrey151
Reviews.Content: the room had a bunk bed, with a significantly larger bottom bed. furnishings were adequate, at least the shower was more decently-sized compared to other ETAPs i've been in. location is great, as the bus ride to Potsdamer Platz is only 2min or so. the bus stop is about a 3min walk from the hotel itself, right next to the entrance to the S-bahn station. breakfast, however, like all ETAP hotels, was mediocre at best. coffee, extremely diluted juice, breads and jams, yoghurt, and cereals. you'll be better off finding breakfast on your own for 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “your employees were all kind and well-educated”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am Accor A Club card holder. I am free lance journalist and travel lot but in a budget priority. I suggest you should include Etap to be able to usethis point card. Another advice: I must travel to Mjunich next month. Your Etaps are all located away from the center. Your group has several IBIS in the town center. I notice that during off season, there are quite numbers of rooms not busy at IBIS. Why don't you arange mobile Etap into IBIS at the last minutes deal. I will be happy to use this system. nagayo taniguchi

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. It is very basic”
Reviews.Author: Dollars1996
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic and rooms are small. There is only enough room to hang 2 or 3 coats. I stayed on the top floor. There were some facts that you should be aware of. 1) The room is very small. While it could sleep 3 there is really no room for luggage or clothes with soo many people. There is a queen bed and twin bed, set-up bunk-bed style in the room. There is only 1 foot of walking space from the wall around the foot of the queen bed. 2) The wall are concrete. This is good for sound, but there is no insulation, thus the walls are cold to the touch.The floors are cheap pads not really carpet. Don't let the photos fool you. 3) The shower is very small and is next to the bed. I bought a bath mat for the shower and a towel mat for the floor as you will step out to a cold floor after showering. There is really no room to dry in the shower. It is small. The light will wake others so watch out. 4) If you are sharing this room with friends, expect to get dressed in the toilet area. It is the only other area with a door. It is larger than the shower though. 5) The internet will not work well if you are located on the end of the hall. It is weak there and I had problems. 6) Like other hotels in Europe, you will not be able to control the temperature. Now that you know these things, I will tell you that I brought a few things to make my stay much more comfortable. I took a collapsible closet. It has about 5 compartments I got from IKEA. It was cheap and help out a lot. The mats and a few removable hooks for shower caps, belts and keys & such were really needed. Normally, I would not consider these things, but this hotel was cheap, the location was very very good (2 blocks from largest piece of the Berlin Wall and Checkpoint Charlie) and the english speaking staff and breakfast was good enough. It is a good place for a backpacker of young married couple. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Paul B Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms with toilet and shower cabins. Friendly staff. 5 Min. walk to Checkpoint Charly and Friedrichstrasse (shopping). 1. Min. to S-bahn station Anhalter Strasse, 5 min. walk to Koch St. underground station. Also other sites, such as Brandenburger Tor and Alexanderplatz can be reached easily on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, very clean and comfortable, friendly staff, very central and located close to an S-Bahn. The only slight issue is that the wifi signal was a bit erratic - but then again it is free.

Reviews.Title: “too small, not pleasent, good lacation”
Reviews.Author: raanan_10
Reviews.Content: True, the hotel's lacation is excelent. A short walking distance from Potsdamer Platz and Brandenburg Gate, S ban just across the srtreet. The hotel is clean, with a concept of accessibility and social values. BUT, the rooms are too small. 2 people found it hard to manage in a room that is set for 2 parents & a child. We didn't like the stay, we tried to refrain from staying un the room. I will not recommend this hotel, and won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel in a fab central location, a minute or so's walk from U & S-bahn stations. Friendly, helpful service. Room clean and comfortable, other than being a bit on the warm side (I think our air con may not have been wrking, but due to our short visit we didn't spend the time asking about it). All in all, we would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, good service, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RicardoSoaresFilho Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being at Etap Berlin felt like a very nice choice to us. The Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station was just by the corner and when you go out from the station you stare at the ruins of the old S-Bahn station used during WWII (Anhalter Tor). Berlin breathes history indeed, and staying at this hotel was a great start point to explore the city. Part of Berlin Wall just one block away as well as the Topographie des Terror museum. The breakfast was fair. She loved the camembert cheese they offered. Clean, simple room. The toilet is small, but it didn't let us down as we spend so little time in there. You can find a supermarket nearby, a good italian restaurant and a great ice cream store (Sommergarten) -- it was sunday, we were tired, we saved the sauerkraut for another day! A little advice: if you do not like sparkling mineral water, avoid "mit Kohlensäure" ones. Other great spots are within walking distance from the Etap hotel (but you can always take a subway or bus to reach them): Brandenburger Tor and Checkpoint Charlie. If you are interested in history, you should not miss the Walking Tour to the Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp. Unforgettable experience. As our last words, we would like to thank the very helpful guy at the reception who pointed us on the right direction to the Schönefeld airport.

Reviews.Title: “new bathroom and bed arrangements disastrous.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: New bathroom and bedroom arrangements disastrous. Bed poor. Your idea to rebrand with these new showers giving straight on to the room are terrible. Your intention to rebrand to Ibis Budget will devalue Ibis. I the stayed in Cracovie two nights. I was unable to enter and close the door in the shower, and unable to sleep on the Saturday night since you were invaded by football supporters who partied. The staff, cleanliness etc; WERE EXCELLENT; I will never again stay at Etape.

Reviews.Title: “Etap Berlin Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, pretty central to everything, good price, friendly staff, comfortable bed, quiet area, had a good night's sleep. I recommend. I will use when I come back to Berlin again. There was nothing I didn't like about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a great price”
Reviews.Author: Haych21
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides everything you need.Location is great, only 1 stop from Potsdamer Platz and walking distance from the metro. Postsdamer Platz is only a 15 minute walk and there are many restaurants/bakeries on the way which allows you to grab breakfast/lunch while walking towards the main attractions. The room was clean but we did experience bites and itchiness while lying on the bed. Besides that the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reasonable pricing, good location, available indoor parking. Nice hotel for a few day stay in Berlin. A bit poor breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all you need. A compact well designed room that contains all that you expect. The breakfast was simple but plentiful. The hotel is only a few steps from the tram and he neighbourhood offers shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Etap Berlin Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel (right next to Novotel and Ibis), close to public transport and main attractions of Berlin. Nice rooms, friendly and helpful staff. The name is a little bit misleading, as it is not really at Potsdamer Platz, but 1 metro stop away at Anhalter Bahnhof. Those who travel with lot of luggage, make sure to take the metro to this stop. All in all, a good-value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At the top of my list when I return to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ziji
Reviews.Content: I think every room in this hotel comes with double-decker beds: single on top, double below. Good value for the price we paid (averaged at €60 a night) and for the location (10 minutes' walk to Potsdamer Platz). The linen, wash basin area (sink is part of the room), WC cubicle and shower cubicle were all very clean. The amenities were adequate (soap, towels, tv, clothes hangers, small desk). Free wi-fi available, just need to sign in each time. We were on the 7th floor, signal was a bit poor in the room at some areas, so it helps to move around to find the best spot. The hotel is on a quiet street and is really only 100 odd meters away from the S station Anhalter Bahnhof. We had breakfast at a little bakery (fresh croissants!) around the corner, next to a minimart. The reception was always helpful with enquiries. Overall a safe, comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap place, wonderful sightseeing base”
Reviews.Author: Macierzanka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and reliable, placed some 10 minutes' walk from Potsdamer Platz and near Anhalter Bahnhoff, which means you can get almost everywhere using the city's transportation system. There's a bus to the Berlin Central railway station, too. There's a small market around the corner left towards Anhalter Bahnhof, and lots of cafes near Checkpoint Charlie, which is also 15 minutes' walk away. You can also get to the Museum of Science on foot from here. In my opinion, this is the place to choose when you're on a budget and want to do Berlin sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Hard act to follow...”
Reviews.Author: m_m2500
Reviews.Content: A very close second to the Etap we just stayed at in Poland. Location was fantastic for sight seeing Berlin. A reasonable range of cafes, restaurants and excellent public transport within walking distance. Well above average Etap standard and the staff were very friendly and professional. Wouldn't hesitate in staying here again for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “best value&location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I always stay in this hotel. It has a great location, 1km away from Brandenburger Tor and across the street from the S/U Bahn, so it's easy to get to any part of the city. The hotel is quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap”
Reviews.Author: pinkpidgin
Reviews.Content: As always Etap hotels offer the very basics for very little money. For €39 a night (at time of booking) you get a private room with ensuite, towels, bedding and a tv. Of course the cheap price means the room is small (no wardrobe or safe but space to hang a few items and a desk), the bed isn't exactly super comfy but ok for a night or two, there are limited electric points and no toiletries or hairdryer. There is however, free Wifi in all rooms which actually works. If you want luxury and comfort look elsewhere, if you want cheap accomodation in a great location this is the hotel for you. Checkpoint Charlie is a 5-10min walk, as is Potsdamer Platz, the Brandenburg gate, Holocaust memorial and Tiergarten. Anhalter Station is at the end of the street. Breakfast is €6 a head for a buffet including cereal, hot drinks, bread and jam and fruit. You'd do better to head out to a local bakery such as Der Backer Feihl (a short walk towards Potsdamer Platz) where a good coffee and huge apple doughnut will set you back about €3. There's also an Aldi round the corner for fruit and yoghurt and other basics. Cafe Stresseman is good for dinner; the staff are friendly and speak English and it is at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, but minimal rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When first arrived at the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful, so no complaints there. The location of the hotel was nice, not right in the centre, but close to a few tube stations. Rooms were pretty basic though, and matress wasn't the most confortable we've slept on. Rooms were nice and clean though, hairdryer was available from reception because there was not one in the room as standard.

Reviews.Title: “City center, cheap”
Reviews.Author: Mariliava
Reviews.Content: nice and big room, small bathrom, but very enough, clean. nice staff. very near the subway. very worthy

Reviews.Title: “Etap-does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very easy to find and only about 500mtrs from Checkpoint Charlie and loads of interesting historical locations. Check in was easy and the room was exactly as depicted on the website. One small criticism was that the carpet in the room could have done with cleaning. Breakfast was typical continental which did get a bit boring after a while. However, it was filling and fresh fruit was always available. My flight home was late at night but was able to leave my suitcase in a secure room for the whole day without any charge and the staff were very friendly, being able to speak english, and knowledgeable about the local area. I will most definitely return to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to saty in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: GregKo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance from major attractions such as the Berlin wall, checkpoint Charlie, Reichstag ..., metro station near hotel. The room and comfort are very simple but it's clean, and honestly, when you are in an amazing city like Berlin, you have no time to waste in a hotel room, so Etap is the perfect place for a good value accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “No reason for me to stay elsewhere in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: m36705
Reviews.Content: Booked the room months before check-in. Got my room immediately. Room is just nice for a solo traveller. Window opens to allow ventilation. Room was warm enough for winter. Bed was comfortable. Sleep was easy and plentiful. Hotel was full but did not hear any noise from neighbours. My only gripe about my room 327 is the water pressure in the shower. It would have been nicer if it were 20% stronger. The hot water flow was not consistent and sometimes only cold water came out at intervals. It would be fine in the summer but not in -5C conditions. Housekeeping doesn't change your bath towel unless you leave it on the floor. I learnt this the hard way. Haha! Here is a tip from hotel to TEGEL airport. (Get rid of your leftover coins and save on taxi) Take bus M29 from the junction of Anhalter Strasse (direction Movenpick hotel) and stop at Ulanstrasse bus stop. At the same bus stop. Take bus M109 to TEGEL. Pay 2.30euro on bus M29, keep the ticket and show it to the bus M109 to continue the ride. Ride ends at the airport. Trip takes a total of 45 mins. (My bus ride started around 14h00 and ended around 14h45) - Buses have next stop LCD indicators so you won't get lost. Back to the hotel review. If you are staying 8 nights like me. Skip the 6 euro breakfast buffet. It's okay but it gets a little monotonous as the items in the little buffet is the same every day. It is ok if you stayed for 1-3 nights. ETAP- if you read this. Please do something about this. It's not difficult. Complimentary wifi is weak but it's there. Front desk staff were helpful when asked for directions and other information. I will stay here again when in Berlin next. But it is so cold that i may not come again during winter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Considering the wonderful location, the efficiency, friendly service and cleanliness we were happy to overlook the lack of one bedsight table light for reading during a difficult night, partly because of a hard mattress, partly because of my husbands snoring. But we had a lovely stay, I will always recommend this Etap establishment and come again.

Reviews.Title: “Etap ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Etap is a cheap hotel with service after that. But as we only sleep for some hours in the room under our visit to Berlin it is ok. Value for money they say and as it is rather low standard on Etap it is really cheap to. But the service and other facilities we needd this time was ok. We have been om Etap Anhalter Bahnhof before and Ibis there too. Sometimes Etap, sometimes Ibis, sometimes something els.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only bad thing I can say about the hotel is the beds - everything else is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very good location - underground just on the corner (Anhalter Bahnhof); clean; silent area; value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, basic functional accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mlindop
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what you would expect from an Etap Hotel, simple, clean, functional. Room was adequate, the black out blind was great, as was the shower and the bed. Breakfast was simple but plentiful. The WiFi connection was slow. Great location 2 mins from the metro With an Etap there isn't much else to review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - No frills & Good Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: RAlegre
Reviews.Content: Reviewing Etap Hotels is always the same: all hotels are so standardize that they look all the same. If you do not care about service and decoration in the room, I recommend the Etap at Potsdamer Platz. The location is great: less than 1 km of important sites such as Postdamer Platz, Brandeburger Tor and Unter den Linden Avenue; rooms are clean but without other amenities such as freezer, telephone and shampoos. If you are planning a trip with lot of sightseeing and almost the whole day out in the city, consider this hotel just to refresh and refuel your batteries for the next day. The staff, altough reduced, is very nice. They also have a very nice breakfast for 6 euros in the eat as much as you can system with several iogurts, bread, gellys and cereals. You can also have rou breakfast in other restaurants near from the hotel for 3.5 euros or less.

Reviews.Title: “central location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: asasBasel
Reviews.Content: Etap Hotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz is only 10 minutes walk away from Potzsdamer Platz, teh new heart of Berlin. As i was travelling on my own, I only had to pay 46 euro instead of 56 euro (plus 6 euro for breakfast) for a night in a triple room to use on my own. There was no noise at night, showers worked, everything was clean... There s the opportunity to hire a bike for around 12 euro a day/8 euro half a day. People at reception are friendly and helpful. It was the second time i stayed at this hotel and I could recommend it to people who look for a central hotel to stay, also for small families, as the rooms are triple rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value no-frills accommodation”
Reviews.Author: vampyresheep
Reviews.Content: Having not stayed at an Etap before, I was a bit concerned about what to expect. On first impression it does look a bit austere and basic, however I have no complaints - a relatively spacious room for the price, with ensuite shower and toilet. a bit strange to have these opening directly into the room rather than a separate bathroom, but at least it saved arguments about one's travel partner hogging the loo when you want a shower! :-) Staff were friendly and helpful. The bicycle hire was a definate plus (with extra bikes available at the Ibis next door should they all be hired out here) Only slight niggle was the heat. All public areas were swelteringly hot and the bedroom aircon didn't do much. Had to sleep with window open and endure traffic noise instead. Forget about the 6 Euro breakfast! 5 minutes down Stresemannstr we found a lovely cafe doing a buffet breakfast for 3.90! The location may be convenient for first time visitors, being a short walk from Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Platz. However for me i found the immediate area to be bland and lacking in character, spending as much time as possible away from there. For a basic stopover this place is great but not if you wish to stay in an area with more character and get a better taste of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great stay clean hotel what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: hsgirl
Reviews.Content: i was plesantly surprised with this hotel.i have stayed in the glasgow etap and new what to expect. the rooms were very clean and bedding changed daily. we stayed for 5 nights. i have no complaints at all. i found checkin staff very helpful. they helped us on where to go and where to eat, We loved loved loved the itailian oppisite check point charlie the food was lush and amazingly cheap. Also have to mention vapiano what a experiance, you have to que up for your food for every course and get a busser, also italian was lovely we ate in both places twice as we just loved te food so much and the bill was so cheap. the hotel is within walking distance from the train and really easy to get to. a short walk to all the major attractions. the beds are really ok medium firm level. which was great after a day round the zoo which is more than a must do!! the tv channels have a few english programs and the music channels are mostly english songs dont think i will ever forget lena satellite lol. we didnt have the breakfast there is an bakery on the corner beside the market and they have great pastrys. we travel in with ryainair.. the trainstaton was easy to find outside te airport and i would recommend remebering to get you ticket punched as the trains arrive very quickly with little warning, we accidently got childerns tickets and the nice lady let us on any ways. can not faulter the german time keeping its amasing wish our trains ran as good as theres. in conculsion i will return to berlin and this etap budget at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Optimum location/price ratio for Berlin sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: NLoriel
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nonexpensive place near the city center and this turned out to be the perfect choice. The hotel is just around the corner from the S-Bahn station Anhalter Bahnhof (2 stops to Friedrichstrasse, and then by S- or U- Bahn anywhere you want) and within a comfortable walking distance (around 10 mins) from a number of U-Bahn stations. It also has a perfect connection with the main railway station (Hauptbahnhof) via the M41 city bus - also in the middle of the night. As for sightseeing, it is about 10 minutes to reach Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Platz, 5 minutes to the closest section of Berlin Wall and about 15 mins to the Technology Museum. Two or three metro stops and you are near the Brandenburger Tor, Unter Den Linden and Museum Island. So this is definitely *the* place for your first visit to Berlin. The hotel itself is pretty basic, but clean and comfortable. We were given a room on the first floor, with window to the street, so I was a bit afraid about the noise, but with the window closed (and yes, there was individual air conditioning) there were no problems with that. Walls are a bit thin, but it wasn't that bad - similarly, in fact, to many higher class hotels. The room houses one double bed and a bunk bed overhead, has private toilet and shower chamber plus sink (two soaps and two glasses) and a mirror. A set of coat hangers, small TV (never turned it on), a small shelf and that be it. The room was clean, though nobody vacuum-cleaned it for the four days we were there and pillows could be a bit more comfortable. But hey, that's OK, we knew the standard beforehand. Breakfast was really worth the 6 EUR/pers we paid for it. Not only does it save you the morning hassle (though there is an Aldi supermarket just around the corner opposite the Anhalter Bhf), but it was much better than the Holiday Express standard we are used to. To sum it all up, we'd definitely stay there again. And if you need higher standard at the same location, you can choose Ibis or Suite Hotel which are located in the same building complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: docdiamond
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really at Potsdamer Platz, but is just a few blocks away. It is near an S Bahn stop and a bus stop. There are restaurants and other hotels on the same street. If you walk toward Checkpoint Charlie (down the street away from the S bahn) there will be grocery stores and a good bakery. Near Checkpoint Charlie, there are a lot of cheap restaurants, including a Turkish place that is very good and extremely cheap. The hotel itself is very clean and offers a very good breakfast at a very reaonable price. The rooms are a little different, as described in the other reviews. It is true that the shower door opens directly into the room, so be prepared. Although the rooms are very compact, they are also quite comfortable. If you leave the window open (we did) the street is a little noisy. This place is a really good value, and we enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Thrifty Convience”
Reviews.Author: Suerdieckreise
Reviews.Content: We recommend this hotel to travelers who want to be in the center of Berlin without having to pay a fortune. Etap is a great bargain, perfect for economy travelers. The room is small, but completely functional with all that one needs for a couple nights stay. Note the shower opens directly into the room and the bed is a bunk bed with a double on the lower end. Best for people traveling together who know each other very well . This may not be the place for more than 2 adults and one child. Everything was clean, in good working order, and very secure, especially the parking garage. Breakfast is included, and in a buffet style, with a variety of fruit, coffee/juices, breads/danishes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bingo2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and it provides great value for money. The rooms are basic, but clean and compact. The vending machine in reception has cheap beer which comes in very handy! I would have no problem staying here again if I went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and convenient”
Reviews.Author: equemac
Reviews.Content: We were 16 of us for a weekend and this hotel is perfect if you really want a very cheap hotel. It´s located in avery good place to see the most important places in Berlin: Brandembourg Gate, Bundestag, wall, checkpoint Charlie, and the new parts of the city. Also, there´s train and underground statio close to the hotel. The street, where it is is very quiet during night. It´s really austere, but clean and comfortable if you only stay for sleep and nothing else. Breakfast is ok, you can choose form different cereals, chesses, and jam. Only orange juice, and no hot food. I relly recommended for a short stay in the city

Reviews.Title: “Clean and small, good value”
Reviews.Author: lastraveler
Reviews.Content: Obviously, you get what you pay for, but this has a great location - directly next to a subway stop that is one stop from Potsdamer Platz and two from the Brandenburg Gate. The room was clean with a small TV. Staff was helpful. Bathroom and shower open directly into room. I had no trouble using the free WIFI, which was a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiguelRamirez
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, has garage but charges for it additionally. Clean, comfy, and close to Potsdamer Platz and the U-Bahn. Other more expensive hotels on the side are Ibis and one more I cant remember.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the euros...”
Reviews.Author: Outonthegolfcourse
Reviews.Content: Close to check point charlie, and close to the underground. Overall it provided a good base for a fair cost. Don't eat at the cafe on the corner - by the underground entrance, our bread had nold on it (yes really) and the staff seemed unconcerned. Also recommend fat tyres bike tour - what a fab day! ; )

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Price, But It Comes With Consequences”
Reviews.Author: brickandmortar
Reviews.Content: The Etap Hotel Potsdamer Platz in Berlin is an amazing deal if you book online. Three of us stayed there (yes, there are beds for three at no exra charge!) for 44Euros per night!. Here's the positives and negatives of staying here: "The Good" -Price -Location (near sightseeing destinations, conveniences and decent restaurants) -Service (for such an inexpensive hotel the staff is incredibly friendly, helpful and service oriented. I asked if they knew of a laundromat to wash my clothes and they let me use the facilities at their sister hotel, "Suitehotel" two doors down, for free!) -Cleanliness (much cleaner than a US hotel in the price range -Cost of Breakfast (only 6E, totally cheap) -Modern (I was amazed how modern and up-to-date the facilities and rooms are). "The Bad" -Comfort (It was hard to get a good night's sleep because the beds are uncomfortable and the linens not great) -Bathrooms (Only stay here if you don't mind if the people sharing your room see you nekkid - seriously - there is no official bathroom space, just two doors in your room: one for a shower and one for a toilet. The sink is in the room. I was in a group of three guys so it was cool, but I could see it awkward for a family). -Small Rooms (Okay, this is Europe, I get it, every hotel seems to have small rooms. There is a desk and a small TV, but there is really no room to move around. It's definitely not the type of room you want to spend your free time in). Air Conditioning (I don't think our air conditioning worked properly and since it was summer in Berlin we had to keep the window open at night and it was noisy). Internet (Don't say it's free wireless if it doesn't work! They always had an excuse and I had to pay and use the lobby machine every time I wanted to go online. Don't believe it when they say there's free wireless, it's worse than dial-up).

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelPune
Reviews.Content: We had initially booked our stay at the IBIS Hotel which is next door but they could not provide us the room and we stayed at Etap. This hotel is at a walking distance from the remains of the Berlin Wall, Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate and Potsdamer Platz. This is a hotel with very basic facilities.The room was small but the bed had a bunk on the top so three people can easily be accomodated. The bath room was clean but also very small. The washbasin was outside the bathroom , in the room. The staff was as usual friendly and helpful as any other Accor Group of Hotels.The locality was quiet and even with windows open, sleep was not a problem. There are numerous restaurants closeby including a good Italian one at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sassa77
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. Immaculate throughout. Very basic rooms, but they have everything you need. Hairdryer is 10E deposit. Good shower. This was my first stay in an Etap Hotel and I was impressed. If you're looking for accomodation on a budget, this fits the bill. Good breakfast too. The restaurant in the Ibis next door is good for dinner, as is the Mexican Steakhouse, a few minutes walk away near the S Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - but just enough of what you need at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: I give this place a 5/5 not because it is tres chic or super posh or full of amenities ... I gave it a top rating because everything else overcompensated for the simplicity of the hotel. The rooms are very basic: double bed, elevated twin bed, desk, chair, TV, sink, shower, toilet. That's it. But really, at the end of the day for a budget traveler ... that's all you need!! The space is pristine, from lobby to dining area to guest rooms. We didn't interact much with the front desk, but when we did, they were helpful. Breakfast was fine, breads / jams / meat / fruit / juice / coffee ... nothing fancy, but it was buffet-style, so you can fill up before heading out. Location is key ... super easy to find on mass transit (and I'd never been to Berlin before), and within walking distance to many sites. Those that are further away are easily accessed through the S-bahn, U-bahn and bus systems, which are all just a block or two away. Will definitely return to this place ... well worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok place”
Reviews.Author: Alface
Reviews.Content: The room is basic but has all you need. Reasonable size also. As you enter the room there is a door on your left with a toilet, further on your left and passing the sink (actually in the room) closed in another small compartment is the shower. NB. When you enter and leave the shower you do so directly into the room. There is a TV and air-conditioned (no individual regulation) no phone and a small place for hanging some shirts. The place is very central although quiet (hardly any noise): 800 m to Potzdam Square. 50 ms to the subway and M29 bus. Breakfast is expensive for what it is: 6 Euros for a small selection of bread, butter, jams, coffee and milk. On the overall basic, inexpensive hotel, very well located. Would stay there again but its not something to write home about (can’t really understand why so many reviewers gave this hotel 5 stars...)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: blommer79
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, calm and functional. But keep in mind that the shower opens directly in the room which could a problem for some people. The breakfast was good. The staff was very friendly. The location was perfect : Postdamer Platz reachable by feet (less than 10 min), close to the topographie of the terrors, 20 min by feet from the Jewish museum, the Reichtag. The bus M29 stop near the hotel. The area is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jennymacHull
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed in an etap hotel before then you will no the drill. Its Basic. I personally love the etap hotel, they are cheap, clean and usually well located. The one at Potdamer Platz was no different. We had no hassle and we never heard any noise from outside the room. Excellent Value! There is a great cafe across the street on the corner which we had breakfast in every morning. We then usually got the U Bahn at Potsdamer Platz which is a 5 minute walk away. This is a very central station which links most areas of the city. I loved Berlin in every way, the shops, food and bars where all excellent. Potsdamer Platz on an evening looks amazing all lit up and the bars / restarants are also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: supersnazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 15-17, 2008. It is a 2-minute walk from the Anhalter station, which was an easy metro connection from the Hauptbanhof. The room is impeccably clean and reasonably sized. The toilet is in a separate room, with the sink located in the room itself. The shower is located off of the room. Be forewarned: the shower exits directly into the room itself. I was travelling with my spouse, so this wasn't an issue. The bed is comfortably firm. It's a bunk bed, with a double bed on the bottom, and a single bed on top, which was perfect for stowing our packs and hanging laundry. The room is also equipped with a TV and a desk, but no telephone. The blind covering the one window is extremely effective at keeping out sunlight. We slept amazingly! The room is quiet; we didn't hear any guests or much noise from outside. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but rather ate at nearby cafés. The hotel is walking distance from Potsdamer Platz and is centrally located. It was the perfect location for us. I would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat - great room, great location, and excellent price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent”
Reviews.Author: darrenmcc
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the this hotel and would not hesitate to return. Comfortable room, friendly staff, good showers, and a view that you could put on postcards. Excellent hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “If you like/know the system is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gomgom
Reviews.Content: the etap-system is easy and simple. Simple room (all of them are the same) but really comfortable for your stay. No noise at all, comfortable bed and AC. perfectly located (close to anhalter S-bahn station)(100m) which allow you to get any part of the city easily. 48 € (1 person) 58 (2 people) is a great price considering the location. the down side is breakfast, not included, 5,5 €, but is very very simple, I payed only once for them. Perfect hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, value for moey”
Reviews.Author: debsj
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day visit to Berlin during which we stayed at the Etap Potsdammer Platz. The hotel is located very close to Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station, and isn't really in Potsdammer Platz at all. But if using the S-Bahn, this hotel provides a very central and accessible base to explore the city. The hotel was basic but adequate, especially given the low prices. The staff were couteous and spoke very good English. There is no luggage room in the hotel, but the larger train stations have luggage lockers which cost 3-5EUR for 24hours, and these are useful if you have time to kill between checking out and going to the airport. The rooms have a double bed with a single bunk on top. There is no actual en suite, just a shower cubicle beside the bed and a small sink unit. Only the toilet is separate. There is also a small desk, small clothes rail and a TV with many German, and only one English channel. The only problems we found were lack of space for storing suitcases, lack of privacy for showering and using the bathroom, and the top bunk would be too small and cramped for anyone other than a child. We would not recommend this type of room for 2 single friends, unless they knew each other extremely well... The breakfast consisted of a selection of cereals, breads and rolls, soft cheeses and pates, jams, yoghurts, hot drinks and orange juice. The only fruit on offer was a bowl of apples. Breakfast is served between 6.30 and 10am. All in all, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best on a Budget, great Location”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltravels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 5+ etaps all around Europe the past few years and this one is as good as they come. For those who've never stayed in one, it's for budget travelers like students and young couples, with the amenities and cleanliness of a 3-star hotel, but almost as cheap and barebones as a hostel. This one is a newer facility, clean, friendly receptionist, perfect central location, near Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Platz. The s-Bahn is around the corner, and few blocks away from the Potsdamer U-bahn. I had a rental car, so the underground parking garage was convenient for 10eu/night. The Ku'damm area is only a 5-10min drive to the west, as well as the Brandenburg gate and Reichstag to the north. and East Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what it is”
Reviews.Author: 1968jaw
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year in Berlin and chose this hotel because it was central and good value. The hotel had only been open a couple of months, so at the time it was spotless throughout. The hotel suited our purpose perfectly: we did not intend to spend much time in the room (there was too much going on in Berlin itself for that - an excellent place to spend New Year, by the way!), and it was just five minutes from the U-Bahn. The Reichstag etc were also within walking distance. I would recommend the hotel to others, with a word of warning: it is built more for function than comfort! There was no bathroom to speak of (a sink and shower cubicle in the room, with a small separate WC), and the furnishings were sparse. It was not the best breakfast either, but I have had many worse. People with children should watch the windows carefully - they open a long way, and we were on the sixth floor! Overall, we wanted a cheap, central hotel - and that is what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Clean + comfortable, great position and all for 43euros!”
Reviews.Author: Lynda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel in the last 3 weeks and will certainly do so again. It offers a reasonable-sized room with comfortable double bed, desk, TV and en-suite facilities for 43 euros! Wonderful for the single traveller. Second person pays 7 euros extra. Breakfast is optional at 5 euros: basic choices but good rolls and jams and excellent coffee too. The hotel opened in Oct last year so everything is still bright and new. It's in an excellent position on Anhalterstrasse, 2 mins walk from Anhalter Bahnhof. Near Potsdamerplatz and Kulturforum museums too, tho' I wd quibble slightly with the name as Potsdamerplatz is an easy walk (or one stop on the S-Bahn) but not its nearest reference point. It's also near Kochstrasse U-Bahn and Checkpoint Charlie, with Martin-Gropius-Bau, Topographie des Terrors and part of the Wall on the next street. The S-Bahn line takes you to Potsdamerplatz and Friedrichstrasse for easy connections. Note that trains heading south from Potsdamerplatz don't (always?) stop at Anhalterbahnhof: you have to go on to Yorckstrasse and go to opposite platform (Retourbahnsteig) to get train back to Anhalter. There's an Italian restaurant on the corner opposite the station if you don't want to go further afield. Payphone and drinks machine in the hotel foyer. Checkout time is 12 (later than lots of places) and if you need a taxi, staff at reception will press a button and a taxi arrives in a minute or two.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value- Central Location”
Reviews.Author: rs899
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, wife and 4 yr old daughter ) stayed in this hotel in mid-March 2005. The hotel (and I believe the Ibis and Suitehotel next to it) were built in late 2004, so the room was new. That said, the shower door was already falling off its hinges. I have never stayed in an Etap before, but I fear that these rooms age poorly as hotels go. Anyway, the room was clean and quiet if small. Our room was on the street, so there was noise with the window open- but with the window closed it was fine- you may want one facing the back. There was about 18 inches of space to the wall at the bottom of the bed in which to move across the room. The upper bunk bed was OK for a child ( I myself slept there two nights)- the bottom bed's mattress was very firm (uncomfortable)foam. The hotel is not really at Potsdamer Platz, but is located on Anhalter Strasse a few blocks away. It is about 100m from the Anhalter Banhof S-Bahn stop and is just south of the Topographie of Terror exhibit (old Gestapo and SS Headquarters) and an intact section of Berlin Wall near Checkpoint Charlie. This is a very good central location. Breakfast was a buffet of rolls, cereals yogurt etc for 5 euro- not bad. Hotel staff spoke English very well and was quite helpful. We paid 50 euro for the room and were happy with it , all told

HotelInfo.Name: Etap Berlin Potsdamer Platz
HotelInfo.Address: Anhalter Str. 6, 10963 Berlin, Germany
